item.title: Report E-2025070539
item.description:
Report E-2025070539

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-26T18:26:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 5:51 AM ET, XCA contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Belle, WV. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Industrial Enamel, which released from 1–55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture on the dock. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents, placed the waste into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Waste ID 242537-1 was generated.

item.title: Report E-2025070023
item.description:
Report E-2025070023

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-26T18:26:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-15
  • City: CLIFTON
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/15/2025 at 1436 hours, CSXT Personnel reported GATX 61265, a residue tank car of hydrochloric acid, had a vapor release from the top area of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Covestro LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC Report # 2025-06-15-00031. SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a torn gasket between the blind flange and liquid line. The issue was identified, and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative, Chad Blake at 304 281 4864. Contractor personnel fixed the problem and cleaned up any spilled material. The leak was secured, and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require the filing of an AAR QA 7.1. NAR Cause Code: 266:5 CSX Incident # R000225783
